detail: Paystack's acquisition also comes despite the uncertain economic realities amid crises triggered by the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: The US trade deficit is hurtling towards an all-time high
detail: The US trade deficit jumped to $67 billion in August. It may be on its way to breaking a record.

title: Your company needs a shadow board of young, non-executive talent
detail: Interbrand's Rebecca Robins argues for incorporating new, diverse perspectives that today’s executives may not have considered.

title: With interest rates near record lows, retirement may have to wait
detail: "This is the hardest investing environment a lot of people have ever had to face."

title: Is Jeff Bezos’ space company making money off the New Shepard rocket?
detail: The suborbital rocket is apparently profitable—depending on how you do the math.

title: Neither Kamala Harris nor the Modi-Trump bonhomie holds much sway over the Indian-American vote
detail: Traditionally voters of the Democratic camp, the prevalent narrative is that a blossoming camaraderie between Trump and Narendra Modi would lead to a widespread defection of Indian Americans towards the Republican party.

title: It took a pandemic to make QR codes a global sensation
detail: China got with the program ages ago. Now that new parts of the world are wising up to the value of QR codes, will they stick?

title: Stuck at home, Indians are spending big bucks on upgrading their kitchens
detail: Flipkart has seen a four-fold increase in the smart kitchen segment, which includes appliances such as kettles, toasters, vacuum cleaners, and water purifiers.

title: Young Nigerian protesters are using social media to dispel misinformation from traditional media
detail: Protesters are sharing videos of their peaceful demonstrations and evidence of police harassment across WhatsApp groups to better inform older Nigerians

title: Once again, NBC decided to serve Trump’s interests
detail: NBC is airing a town hall with Donald Trump at the same time as ABC's event with Joe Biden, forcing viewers to choose between the two.

title: Fashion is struggling to rise to the creative challenge of Covid-19
detail: Rather than try to propose a way forward for fashion in the era of Covid-19, designers mostly carried on with business as usual at Paris Fashion Week.

title: What happens to absentee ballots after you mail them?
detail: The verification and counting of absentee ballots can begin long before Election Day.

title: China’s election to the UN Human Rights Council revealed its shaky global status
detail: Beijing had the lowest vote total among the 15 countries elected, indicating growing international backlash.

title: Tanishq is only the latest brand to face the ire of India’s easily offended right wing
detail: The brand, owned by the 100-year-old Tata Group, had to take down the 40-second ad—that showed a Hindu girl married into a Muslim family—under pressure, as #boycottTanishq trended on social media for nearly two days.

title: Can rapid antigen tests fix contact tracing in the US?
detail: Because antigen tests are cheaper, they could be used more frequently, making it easier to spot exactly when a person becomes infectious.

title: Five things individuals can do to fight climate change
detail: Ordinary people can fight climate change—but reducing your greenhouse gas emissions is only the first step.

title: Amazon and Flipkart are serving a new India during this year’s festive sales
detail: From ensuring safety and hygiene to finding the right products that'll sell in these uncertain times and reaching shoppers in remote regions, there's a lot for Flipkart and Amazon to think.

title: Apple will change the way we charge phones
detail: Apple changed up the accessories that come with a new iPhone 12, potentially unlocking a charging revolution.

title: Disney is now a streaming company
detail: The company announced a strategic reorganization that will prioritize its streaming services: Disney+, ESPN+, and Hulu.

title: Dropbox commits to going “virtual-first” by converting offices to meeting studios
detail: When Dropbox reopens next summer, its employees will no longer have an office with individual desks, but instead will have access to studios while they continue to work from home.

title: The business interests behind vaccine trials work against people of color
detail: Covid-19 vaccine trials are struggling to recruit diverse patients as the industry works to undo long-standing exclusionary practices.

title: What is owed Africa
detail: Africa lost 12.5 million men, women, and children to the international slave trade. How should its people be compensated?
